item.title: Upgrading my Portfolio to Nextjs13
item.description: In thi blog I detail the journey of upgrading my portfolio to Next.js 13 while transitioning tothe /app structure. The integration of an MDX-powered blog, facilitated by Contentlayer, enhanced my portfolio's deptheffortlessly. And many more problems which needed to be solved due to the big change in syntax.
item.author: david

item.title: Making a Multiplayer FPS: Basic Movement
item.description: In this post, I've successfully implemented basic player movement. Players can move, jump, and look around with intuitive controls. Addressing the jittery movement issue during multiplayer gameplay, I'll introduce interpolation for smoother player experiences.
item.author: david

item.title: Making a Multiplayer FPS: Introduction
item.description: In this blog series, I'll be taking you through the thrilling process of creating my own online first-person shooter (FPS) game. As an avid FPS gamer, I've chosen Unity as my game engine and the "Riptide" multiplayer library to ensure a smooth multiplayer experience.
